# Ethereum Wallet Toolkit

> A comprehensive Python CLI toolkit for Ethereum wallet operations using official Ethereum Foundation libraries.

## Quick Summary

This toolkit provides secure, auditable tools for:
- Generating random Ethereum wallets
- Creating vanity addresses (prefix/suffix matching)
- BIP39 mnemonic generation and restoration
- BIP32 HD wallet derivation
- Message signing and verification (EIP-191)
- Address and key validation
- Contract address prediction (CREATE/CREATE2)

## Core Files

- `eth_toolkit.py` - Main CLI tool (1500 lines, full-featured)
- `vanity.py` - Standalone vanity address generator
- `offline.html` - Offline wallet generator (browser-based)

## Documentation

- `/docs/API.md` - Complete API reference with code examples
- `/docs/SECURITY.md` - Security best practices and threat model
- `/docs/VANITY.md` - Vanity address technical guide
- `/docs/VANITY_RESOURCES.md` - Research compilation on vanity address security

## Dependencies

All from Ethereum Foundation (audited, official):
- eth-account: Key generation, signing, HD wallets
- eth-keys: ECDSA operations
- eth-utils: Utility functions
- eth-rlp: RLP encoding

## Usage Examples

```bash
# Generate random wallet
python eth_toolkit.py generate

# Generate with 24-word mnemonic
python eth_toolkit.py generate --mnemonic --words 24

# Vanity address (prefix "dead")
python eth_toolkit.py vanity --prefix dead

# Sign message
python eth_toolkit.py sign --key <key> --message "Hello"

# Verify signature
python eth_toolkit.py verify --address <addr> --message "Hello" --signature <sig>
```

## Key Security Notes

- EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY - no liability
- Uses OS-level CSPRNG (not weak seeds like Profanity)
- Always audit code before use
- Never use with real funds
- Run offline for maximum security
